docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 20(AP)  A goal by Wolfgang Overath at the 27-minute mark gave West Germany a 1-0 victory today over Uruguay and third place in the 1970 World Cup soccer championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 20(AP) A goal by Wolfgang Overath at the 27-minute mark gave West Germany a 1-0 victory today over Uruguay and third place in the 1970 World Cup soccer championship.

headline.main: West Germany Conquers Uruguay, 1-0, for Third Place in World Cup Soccer; OVERATH SCORES WINNING TALLY 80,000 in Aztec Stadium See 2d-half Drives by Losers Foiled at Goal Line

docs.snippet: Brazil and Italy, two of the most colorful and exciting teams in the tournament, will meet for the World Cup soccer championship today in a game to be shown on closed-circuit television at Madison Square Garden and the New York Coliseum. The telecast...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil and Italy, two of the most colorful and exciting teams in the tournament, will meet for the World Cup soccer championship today in a game to be shown on closed-circuit television at Madison Square Garden and the New York Coliseum. The telecast will begin at 2 P.M., live and in color via satellite with English commentary.
docs.abstract: Levitt lr on telecast of his play

headline.main: BRAZIL AND ITALY PLAY FINAL TODAY; Garden, Coliseum to Show World Soccer Telecast

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 20  If Italy is to win the World Cup tomorrow for the first time in 32 years, its chance must rest on Felix and on desperation. Felix, the Brazilian goalkeeper, must be one of the worst goalkeepers ever to play in a World Cup soccer...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 20 If Italy is to win the World Cup tomorrow for the first time in 32 years, its chance must rest on Felix and on desperation. Felix, the Brazilian goalkeeper, must be one of the worst goalkeepers ever to play in a World Cup soccer final. He is as unsafe, as indecisive and as worrisome to the Brazilian defense as his predecessor, Gylmar, was sound and sure.

headline.main: World Cup Finale; Brazil, Even With an Indecisive Goalie, Seems Too Strong for Cautious Italians

byline.original: By BRIAN GLANVILLE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY The eyes of 300 million television viewers from the Soviet Union to Chile, from South Africa to northern Europe will be on Aztec Stadium here today for what most of the non-Asiatic world considers the supreme sports event of the year: the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY The eyes of 300 million television viewers from the Soviet Union to Chile, from South Africa to northern Europe will be on Aztec Stadium here today for what most of the non-Asiatic world considers the supreme sports event of the year: the final game of the world soccer championship between Brazil and Italy.

headline.main: World Soccer Is a Mad, Mad World

docs.snippet: Dozens of major Wall Street law firms have a lot in common--offices in the financial district, corporate giants as clients, scores of lawyers with degrees from the best schools, and not a few partners whose annual income is in six figures.

headline.main: Three Women Lawyers in Major League of the Legal Profession

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 21-- Brazil, with a crushing 4-1 victory over Italy, won the ninth World Cup soccer championship today and gained permanent possession of the Jules Rimet Trophy, symbol of world supremacy in the sport.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 21-- Brazil, with a crushing 4-1 victory over Italy, won the ninth World Cup soccer championship today and gained permanent possession of the Jules Rimet Trophy, symbol of world supremacy in the sport.

headline.main: Pele Stars as Brazil Beats Italy, 4-1, for World Cup Soccer Crown; FORWARD SCORES, SETS UP 3 GOALS 112,000 in Aztec Stadium See Brazilians Tally 3 Times in Second Half

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 22-- A spokesman at the Library of Congress said today that at least 35 countries in addition to the United States, 13 of them Communist, now allowed voting at age 18.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 22-- A spokesman at the Library of Congress said today that at least 35 countries in addition to the United States, 13 of them Communist, now allowed voting at age 18.

headline.main: At Least 35 Countries Now Allow Vote at 18

docs.snippet: In Harlem, the youngsters would recognize Dean Meminger without the Rice High School equipment bag he carries or the Maxquette University sweat suit he puts on or his National Invitation Tournament championship watch, and even though its nice to be...
docs.lead_paragraph: In Harlem, the youngsters would recognize Dean Meminger without the Rice High School equipment bag he carries or the Maxquette University sweat suit he puts on or his National Invitation Tournament championship watch, and even though its nice to be recognized, it's nicer still just to be there.
